The Library of Whispering Scrolls welcomes you. Candles flicker, dusty tomes float around, and a hooded wizard mutters:
"Words are not just words here. They are weapons. Shout them, twist them, slice them ‚Äî and reality bends to your will."
This week you learn String Magic: the art of controlling text in Python.
Every word is a spell. Every letter is a rune. Every method is a magic incantation.
Only those who master words can open locked doors, confuse goblins, or rename slimes into‚Ä¶ toast.

content.text: A string is text inside quotes. It could be one word, a whole sentence, or even ‚ÄúAHHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!‚Äù (battle cry).
In Python, strings are like magic scrolls. Whatever you write can be read, shouted, or transformed.

Strings are made of characters ‚Äî each character has a position (index).
Indexing lets you grab a single rune (like the 1st letter). Slicing lets you tear out a piece of the scroll.

content.starter_code:

print(spell[0])   # F 
print(spell[1:4]) # ire

items: spell[0] is like pointing to the first glowing rune.
spell[1:4] is tearing a section of the scroll that says "ire" ‚Äî maybe useful for ‚Äúinspire‚Äù or ‚Äútire‚Äù spells.

lessons.title: Challenge Quest - The Magic Door of Destiny

items: You stand before a towering magic door in the Library of Whispering Scrolls.
Glowing runes swirl across its surface:

content.text: sword of light

The door hums:
"To pass, prove your mastery of word sorcery. Fail‚Ä¶ and be turned into a library bookmark forever." üìöüò±
Tasks (Step by Step)

items: Print the inscription in ALL CAPS with .upper(). The runes will glow when you shout them.
Replace "light" with "destiny". Print the new inscription: "sword of destiny".
Slice out the word "sword". This reveals the weapon hidden in the door.
Print the inscription in lowercase with .lower(). The door chuckles when you whisper the runes.
Use .find("light") to locate where "light" begins in the string. This tells you where the magic word is carved on the door.

content.starter_code:
# Write your Python code here
print("Hello, World!")
content.expected_output:
SWORD OF LIGHT 
sword of destiny 
sword 
sword of light 
9
content.solution:
inscription = "sword of light" 
 
# 1. Shouting Spell 
print(inscription.upper())   # SWORD OF LIGHT 
 
# 2. Replacement Spell 
print(inscription.replace("light","destiny"))  # sword of destiny 
 
# 3. Rune Slicing 
print(inscription[0:5])      # sword 
 
# 4. Whisper Spell 
print(inscription.lower())   # sword of light 
 
# 5. Detect Spell 
print(inscription.find("light"))   # position of 'light'
